Значения

Дверь, створка двери

Мнемоника

Калитка 戸. Поворачивается в обе стороны, как крылья у птицы 非.

fēi
door with only one leaf
дверь только с одной створкой
rtega_mnemonic:
扉扉RSdoor panel, front door, title page, front page
  • part of a door 戶 that can open independently but usually doesn't move 非
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 非 indicates the sound; 户 (door) conveys the meaning.

Keyword_KANJIDIC: front door, title page, front page
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: передняя дверь, титульный лист, титульный лист
koohiiStory1: The only way out of a jail cell is to serve your time and walk out the front door. There are no other doors.
koohiiStory2: An old man serving a very long jail sentence painted a life-like door at the back of his jail cell, hlafway open, with the blue sky, clouds, etc, as some kind of symbol of freedom. Every time the prison officers come to take him they ask him to come to the door. The old man with a grin always answers "Which door?", looking at his painted door with a grin. And the prison officer always answer, sighing - "The front door !".
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The door a criminal will get into is the front door. Now hold on, you may be thinking, wouldn't they go for the back door? No! 99% of home invasions happen when you leave your own front door unlocked!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: You better check the locks on your front door right now, because odds are you left it open and didn't even notice. It's the perfect door for a criminal to get access to your home.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: To protect your front door from criminals you plan to fill it with heat (ひ). Oh yeah, we're gonna Kevin McCallister this.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine how you'd heat up your front door. A hot iron? A blow torch? A small fire? It doesn't matter how, as long as the heat makes it all the way through your front door and hurts any criminals trying to get into it.
Ru_Meaning: front door, title page, front page
Ru_Notes: Фонетик: 非 (あらず、ヒ не-); смысловой компонент: 戸 (と、コ дверь).
Ru_Radicals: 一 (один), 尸 (труп), 戸 (дверь), 非 (не)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: a mistaken (非) door (戸) is still a door
humanum_full_description_en:
Oracle's " Men " (Erhu), " Fei " sound, is the first article of " Fei ". The original meaning is the door leaf, the seal script saves a household to write " Fei ".

"Said Wen": "Fei, Hu Shan Ye. Cong Hu, Fei Sheng." "Er Ya. "Shi Gong": "Fu is the door." Xing Bingshu: "Fu, the door leaf. A door." In the handed down literature, " Fu " is also used in the original meaning, referring to door leaf. "Zuo Zhuan. The 28th Year of Xianggong": "Ziwei pulls out and strikes Fusan." Du's note: "Fei, the door is closed." In modern Chinese, " Fei " also refers to the first page of the cover of books and periodicals. Author and other information, so there are words such as "title page" and "title painting".

The oracle " Fei " is suspected to be used as a place name, "Compilation" 15844: "Today's blessing is in Quefei", or refers to the current blessing in Quefei.
humanum_short_description_en: Oracle's " Men " (Erhu), " Fei " sound, is the first article of " Fei ". The original meaning is door leaf.
humanum_full_description:
甲骨文從「門」(二戶)，「非」聲，是「扉」的初文。本義是門扇，篆文省去一戶寫作「扉」。

　　《說文》：「扉，戶扇也。從戶，非聲。」《爾雅．釋宮》：「闔謂之扉。」邢昺疏：「闔，門扇也。一名扉。」傳世文獻「扉」亦多用作本義，指門扇。《左傳．襄公二十八年》：「子尾抽桷擊扉三。」杜預注：「扉，門闔也。」「扉」在現代漢語還引申指書刊封面內的第一頁，多列有書名、著者等資料，因此又有「扉頁」、「扉畫」等詞。

　　甲骨文「扉」疑用作地名，《合集》15844：「今福于雀扉」，或指現在於雀扉一地進行福祭。
humanum_short_description: 甲骨文從「門」(二戶)，「非」聲，是「扉」的初文。本義是門扇。

扉(とびら): door, opening

甲骨文從「 門 」(二戶)，「 非 」聲，是「 扉 」的初文。本義是門扇，篆文省去一戶寫作「 扉 」。 《說文》：「扉，戶扇也。從戶，非聲。」《爾雅．釋宮》：「闔謂之扉。」邢昺疏：「闔，門扇也。一名扉。」傳世文獻「 扉 」亦多用作本義，指門扇。《左傳．襄公二十八年》：「子尾抽桷擊扉三。」杜預注：「扉，門闔也。」「 扉 」在現代漢語還引申指書刊封面內的第一頁，多列有書名、著者等資料，因此又有「扉頁」、「扉畫」等詞。 甲骨文「 扉 」疑用作地名，《合集》15844：「今福于雀扉」，或指現在於雀扉一地進行福祭。
Oracle's " Men" (Erhu), " Fei" sound, is the first article of " Fei". The original meaning is the door leaf, the seal script saves a household to write " Fei". "Said Wen": "Fei, Hu Shan Ye. Cong Hu, Fei Sheng." "Er Ya. "Shi Gong": "Fu is the door." Xing Bingshu: "Fu, the door leaf. A door." In the handed down literature, " Fu" is also used in the original meaning, referring to door leaf. "Zuo Zhuan. The 28th Year of Xianggong": "Ziwei pulls out and strikes Fusan." Du's note: "Fei, the door is closed." In modern Chinese, " Fei" also refers to the first page of the cover of books and periodicals. Author and other information, so there are words such as "title page" and "title painting". The oracle " Fei" is suspected to be used as a place name, "Compilation" 15844: "Today's blessing is in Quefei", or refers to the current blessing in Quefei.

扉字的基本解释

扉
fēi
门扇：柴扉。荆扉。窗扉。
作用与门扇相似的：扉页（书刊封面之内印着书名、著者的一页）。心扉（思考问题的门路）。

扉字的汉语字典释义

[①]［fēi］
［《廣韻》甫微切，平微，非。］
(1)门扇。
(2)屋舍。

扉字的英文翻译

◎ 扉
door leaf

扉字的康熙字典解释

【卯集中】【户字部】　扉； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页416第19
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】甫微切【正韻】方微切，?音非。【說文】戶扇也。【爾雅·釋宮】闔謂之扉。【又】以木曰扉，以葦曰扇。

扉字的源字形

扉字的起名意思

本义指门扇，后引申为屋舍。

Fei
fēi
Door leaf: Chai Fei. Jing Fei. casement.
The function is similar to the door leaf: the title page (a page with the title and author printed on the cover of the book). Heart (a way to think about problems).

【Tang Yun】【Ji Yun】【Rhyme Meeting】Finally cut slightly [Zheng Yun] Fang Wei cut,? The sound is not. [Said the text] Household fans are also. 【Erya·Shigong】It's called the fate. [Also] The wood is called the door, and the reed is called the fan.

Source glyph
Fei
Name meaning
The original meaning refers to the door leaf, which is later extended to the house.
扉
形声字。户表意,古文字形体像单扇的门,表示扉是门扇;非(fei)表声,其形像鸟的翅膀左右张开的样子,表示门扇也
是可以开合的。本义是门扇。
门扇:门~「柴~|心~。
fēi
~画 ~页 柴~ 荆~ 门~ 心~
原。
属扉扉。
Фэй
Пиктофонетические символы.
Идеограмма домашнего хозяйства подобна единственной двери в древних иероглифах, что означает, что дверь есть дверь; фэй подобен птичьим крыльям, что означает, что дверь также можно открывать и закрывать.
Первоначальное значение - дверное полотно.
Дверное полотно: Дверь ~ "Чай ~ | Сердце ~".
~ Нарисовать ~ Пейдж Чай ~ Цзин ~ Дверь ~ Сердце ~
оригинал.
Принадлежат Фэй Фэй.
fēi
сущ.
1) навесная (створчатая) дверь; створка; дверка, калитка
撃扉三 трижды постучать в дверь
扉户 створчатая дверь
2) бедное жилище; хижина
欲去公门归野扉 хотел бы покинуть я княжьи хоромы и в сельскую лачугу возвратиться
Radicals: 戸, 非  (door, criminal)
Meaning Mnemonic
The door a criminal will get into is the front door. Now hold on, you may be thinking, wouldn't they go for the back door? No! 99% of home invasions happen when you leave your own front door unlocked!
You better check the locks on your front door right now, because odds are you left it open and didn't even notice. It's the perfect door for a criminal to get access to your home.
Reading Mnemonic
To protect your front door from criminals you plan to fill it with heat (ひ). Oh yeah, we're gonna Kevin McCallister this.
Imagine how you'd heat up your front door. A hot iron? A blow torch? A small fire? It doesn't matter how, as long as the heat makes it all the way through your front door and hurts any criminals trying to get into it.
